title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: The process of reverting a file is significantly slower than closing and reopening the file in the Java editor.
OB: When I open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository and make a change to the file, the following behavior occurs:
EB: After making a change to the file, I expect the revert operation to be as fast as closing the file and reopening it.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 
2) Make a change to the file by selecting the end of the first line and adding a space character.
3) Wait for the file to be marked dirty.
4) Perform the following steps: 
   a) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
   b) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
   c) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5) Observe the time it takes for the file to close and reopen.
6) Repeat steps 1) and 2).
7) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
8) Observe the time it takes for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original contents of the file.
